Entities.Name: Primary Site
Entities.Definition: The anatomical origin of the tumor, matched to International Classification of Diseases for Oncology topography codes.

Sample Data.Sentence: The patient's primary site of cancer was identified as the lung, specifically the lower lobe.

Entities.Name: Histological Grade
Entities.Definition: The classification of the tumor based on the appearance of cells under a microscope, which indicates how quickly the tumor is likely to grow and spread.

Sample Data.Sentence: Histological analysis shows a grade II tumor, indicating moderately differentiated cells.

Dataset.Name: SEER Pathology Reports
Dataset.Details: 942 de-identified pathology reports collected by the National Cancer Institute Surveillance, Epidemiology, and End Results program, used for training and evaluating the information extraction models.

Annotation Guidelines.Description: Reports were annotated for primary site and histological grade by experts, with additional information extraction performed by automated systems based on hierarchical attention networks. Specific guidelines for the manual annotation process are not detailed in the document.
